::Zardus/Repressor::

Zardus frowns, looking at Lady Hawk. "That's easily discovered," 
Zardus says, reffering to her accusations on Squizzy, "Squizzy is 
programmed to be loyal to me. Part of that is honesty. I'm afrait I 
must insist on being flown to the base by Repressor. You shall walk 
if you're proven innocent."

He looks at Repressor and Najah. "I must go to the Alliance base. 
Make sure she gets there."

He activates his jetpack, flying off toward the Alliance base.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Repressor steps closer to Lady Hawk. "Any particular way you want to 
get back to base?"




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Lady Hawk glared a frozen stare at ZArdus. She knew that she was 
outnumbered
> and overpowered. She'd let her gaurd down one to many times. Now 
was the
> time for the tough act. "Squizzy wanted credit for my expriments, I 
had to
> do to her before she did to me." She squirmed a little moire trying 
to get
> at least her wings uncramped. "I'm sure you'd have done the same if 
someone
> wanted to steal your technology."  Lady Hawk was playing on Zardus' 
logic to
> escape this situation. "I came to you alone and with technology 
that could
> help you in your goals." Logic dictated that she'd be stupid to 
challenge
> the alliance one on all. "Now that I've answered you would you 
release me
> and at least grant me the dignitty of walking on my own two feet?"
